message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.CR, cs.AI 

This paper deals with the problem of noisy computations during inference in deep learning systems. The paper discusses the use of analog neuromorphic circuits to reduce power consumption and the problems of limited precision and unavoidable analog noise. This suggests that the paper is likely to be categorized under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the use of noisy inference as a defensive architecture against black-box adversarial attacks, which suggests that it could also be categorized under cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper discusses the use of noise-injected training and a voting method to improve inference accuracy, which suggests that it could also be categorized under cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
